title: Strategic Marketing
text: Below are selected projects that showcase my work in strategic marketing, campaign development, and brand management. These examples highlight how I apply leadership, data-informed decision making, and creative direction to drive marketing success.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 1: Strategic Campaign Planning]
In this project, I led the development of a comprehensive marketing campaign for [product, service, or initiative]. From audience segmentation to messaging strategy, I managed the full lifecycle of the campaign, aligning it with business objectives and measurable KPIs.
Skills Demonstrated:

Marketing Strategy: Defined objectives and tactics for maximum impact.
Team Coordination: Oversaw collaboration across creative, data, and channel teams.
Performance Tracking: Implemented real-time metrics and post-campaign analysis.
Brand Positioning: Ensured consistency across all touchpoints.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 2: Brand Audit & Positioning]
This initiative involved conducting a full brand audit for [organization or brand], evaluating its current market perception, competitive landscape, and customer engagement. I synthesized insights into a refreshed brand strategy and visual identity recommendations.
Skills Demonstrated:

Brand Analysis: Audited messaging, tone, and visual identity.
Competitive Benchmarking: Evaluated brand positioning within the market.
Strategic Communication: Developed new value propositions and storytelling elements.
Stakeholder Presentation: Delivered recommendations to senior leadership.

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 3: Product Launch Go-to-Market Plan]
For the release of [new product/service], I created a go-to-market (GTM) strategy from scratch. This included customer journey mapping, channel mix planning, and launch timeline coordination.
Skills Demonstrated:

Go-to-Market Strategy: Developed a clear launch roadmap aligned with buyer needs.
Integrated Marketing: Orchestrated email, paid ads, social, and on-site promotions.
Budget Management: Allocated resources efficiently across tactics.
Launch Optimization: Tracked performance and refined tactics in real time.

Below is an embedded demonstration of the interactive report:

title: Strategic Marketing
text:
[Project Title 4: Client Consulting & Campaign Optimization]
I collaborated with a client to assess and optimize their existing marketing efforts. Through audits, persona development, and campaign refinement, I helped improve ROI and audience engagement.
Skills Demonstrated:

Client Consulting: Provided clear insights and strategic guidance.
Persona Development: Built target personas to guide messaging.
Campaign Optimization: Identified and addressed areas of underperformance.
Data-Driven Adjustments: Leveraged analytics to refine tactics.

title: Professional Summary

This analysis examined engagement metrics across multiple social media platforms to identify content trends, audience preferences, and posting strategies that drive performance.

title: Customer Segmentation Using Clustering
text:
Overview
In this analysis, customer data was segmented using clustering algorithms to identify meaningful groups. These segments informed targeting strategies and personalization efforts.




Learning Outcomes

Clean and prepare customer-level data.

Apply clustering techniques to group similar customers.

Interpret clusters to define marketing personas.

Recommend tailored messaging strategies.

Support targeted campaign development.

Customer profiling

R or Python for machine learning

title: Campaign Insights Dashboard
text:
Overview
This project involved building a dashboard to track and visualize marketing campaign performance. Metrics like click-through rate, conversion rate, and ROI were tracked across channels using R and Tableau.




Learning Outcomes

Visualize and monitor key marketing metrics.

Analyze performance trends across multiple campaigns.

Identify high- and low-performing segments.

Communicate insights through interactive visuals.

Develop data-informed recommendations.

Dashboard development

Campaign analytics

Data wrangling in R

Tableau or R Shiny visualization

Performance measurement

title: Hi, I’m Jonny De La Torre
text: I’m a technical writer and digital marketer. I transform raw data into actionable insights, blending technical expertise with creative strategy to drive impactful solutions.

title: Hi, I’m Jonny De La Torre
text:
About Me
I’m a Technical Writer – Senior Specialist at Southern California Edison and a Master of Science in Digital Marketing candidate at Cal Poly Pomona, graduating in Summer 2025. With a background in English Literature and over a decade of writing experience, I specialize in transforming complex information into clear, engaging, and actionable insights—whether through regulatory documentation, marketing analytics, or data-driven storytelling.
I’ve written and managed over 900 pages of technical documentation, collaborated across regulatory, legal, and program teams, and contributed to high-stakes reporting initiatives. My academic work extends that clarity into digital strategy, using tools like R, Python, and Quarto to uncover insights and build reproducible workflows.

title: Hi, I’m Jonny De La Torre
text:
What I Do

Data Analysis & Visualization: Creating interactive and informative visualizations using R.
Digital Marketing Strategies: Leveraging web analytics, SEO, and targeted campaigns to boost online presence.
Technical Writing: Developing clear, accurate, and compliant documentation, including operational procedures and user guides.
Content Creation: Crafting engaging and informative marketing copy for web, email, and social media channels.

title: Hi, I’m Jonny De La Torre
text:
Let’s Connect
You can email me or connect on LinkedIn.

Welcome to my portfolio.

title: Marketing Analytics
text:
In my journey as a marketing analyst, I have consistently transformed complex marketing data into clear, actionable insights, driving informed decisions and tangible business results. My experience spans a wide range of analytical techniques, including predictive modeling, pricing analysis, segmentation, and campaign performance evaluation. These projects reflect my ability to seamlessly integrate statistical tools, data visualization, and strategic thinking to solve real-world marketing challenges.
I specialize in uncovering consumer insights, optimizing pricing strategies, and evaluating marketing effectiveness, always focused on turning data into a competitive advantage. Below are selected projects that showcase my expertise in marketing analytics.

title: Marketing Analytics
text:
What You’ll Find

Consumer Behavior Analysis: Identified key drivers of customer loyalty for Baskin-Robbins using regression and chi-square tests.
Pricing Optimization: Assessed consumer willingness to pay for Netflix plans using Van Westendorp, Gabor-Granger, and Conjoint Analysis.
Customer Segmentation: Developed customer personas through cluster analysis, revealing high-value and low-value segments.
Campaign Performance Evaluation: Measured digital marketing effectiveness using interactive dashboards for real-time insights.
SEO & Web Analytics: Improved website visibility and user engagement through data-driven SEO strategies.

title: Student Exam Scores Project
text:
Overview
The Student Exam Scores Project aimed to investigate the impact of two critical factors on students’ academic performance in mathematics, reading, and writing. Specifically, the project focused on examining the effects of completing a test preparation course and parental education level on students’ exam scores. Using machine learning models, including linear regression and random forest, the analysis explored how these independent variables influence students’ scores across the three subjects. The results provided insights into the significance of these factors and highlighted the predictive capabilities of the models used.


Link
View Student Exam Scores Project



Learning Outcomes

Understand the impact of test preparation courses and parental education levels on student exam performance.
Apply machine learning models, including linear regression and random forest, to predict educational outcomes.
Interpret model performance metrics such as RMSE, MAE, and R-squared to assess model accuracy.
Draw data-driven conclusions regarding the influence of parental education and test preparation on exam scores.
Develop critical skills in model selection, evaluation, and interpretation of results.




Key Skills Gained

Proficiency in using linear regression and random forest models for educational data analysis.
Ability to evaluate model performance using metrics like RMSE, MAE, and R-squared.
Skills in data preparation, including feature selection and data cleaning.
Competence in interpreting statistical results and making data-driven recommendations.
Experience in effectively communicating analytical findings in a clear, structured format.

title: Autonomous Stores Project
text:
Overview
This project analyzed the impact of autonomous store features on customer patronage, focusing on key factors like convenience, autonomy, and safety. Using a conjoint analysis approach with 700 UK participants, the study explored how different levels of in-store automation affected customer decisions. Findings revealed significant insights into customer preferences, which guided recommendations for optimizing autonomous store designs.


Link
View Autonomous Stores Presentation



Learning Outcomes

Understand customer preferences for autonomous store features.
Identify the impact of convenience, autonomy, and safety on patronage.
Analyze customer perceptions using hierarchical linear modeling.
Explore the role of store location in moderating customer behavior.
Generate data-driven recommendations for autonomous store design.




Key Skills Gained

Conjoint analysis & survey design
Hierarchical linear modeling
Customer behavior analysis
Data storytelling & visualization
Strategic recommendations development

title: Texas Home Forecasting
text:
Overview
This project focused on analyzing the Texas housing market using the “txhousing” dataset from ggplot2, covering the period from 2000 to 2015. Our primary objective was to forecast future housing prices and sales volumes in Texas, specifically within the top five counties identified by median price. By leveraging historical data and applying advanced forecasting techniques like ARIMA, we aimed to provide actionable insights for potential investors, highlighting trends, regional price differences, and market dynamics. The analysis identified consistent upward trends in housing prices, driven by strong demand and limited supply, with regional variations in market behavior.


Link
View Forecasting Final Project



Learning Outcomes

Understand and apply forecasting techniques, including ARIMA, to real-world datasets.
Identify and interpret key market trends, including price growth and sales dynamics.
Evaluate regional market variations and their impact on investment decisions.
Develop data-driven investment recommendations based on historical analysis.
Enhance proficiency in data cleaning, visualization, and analysis using R.




Key Skills Gained

Time Series Forecasting (ARIMA Modeling)
Data Cleaning and Preparation (R and ggplot2)
Data Visualization (R - ggplot2)
Market Trend Analysis
Investment Strategy Development
Collaborative Research and Report Writing

title: Baskin-Robbins Project: Marketing Analytics Project
text:
Overview
This project aimed to analyze customer loyalty for Baskin-Robbins, focusing on identifying key factors that drive customer satisfaction and repeat business. Using survey data from 71 respondents, the study employed statistical techniques like regression analysis and chi-square tests to explore the impact of product quality, flavor variety, and seasonal offerings on customer loyalty. The analysis revealed that product quality significantly influenced customer retention, while seasonal flavors had minimal impact. The findings were used to provide actionable recommendations for Baskin-Robbins to enhance customer loyalty, such as prioritizing product quality and exploring new customer engagement strategies.


Link
View Baskin-Robbins Project: Marketing Analytics Project



Learning Outcomes

Design and Implement Surveys.

Perform Data Cleaning and Preparation.

Apply Statistical Techniques.

Analyze Customer Behavior.

Generate Data-Driven Recommendations.

Visualize Key Insights.




Key Skills Gained

Survey Design and Data Collection

Data Cleaning and Preprocessing

Statistical Analysis

Data Visualization

Data-Driven Decision Making

Reporting and Presentation

objectID: listings/04-6530 Statistics without borders Term Project.html
href: listings/04-6530 Statistics without borders Term Project.html
title: Statistics Without Borders Term Project
text:
Overview
This project, titled “Statistics Without Borders: Survey Data Generation & Analysis,” focused on understanding students’ perceptions, usage, and concerns regarding generative AI tools at Cal Poly Pomona (CPP). Using a stratified survey approach, the study explored various aspects of AI interaction, including familiarity with AI tools, perceived risks, support needs, and differences in attitudes based on technical expertise. Key insights revealed significant concerns around data privacy, academic integrity, and critical thinking. The analysis also identified a strong demand for clear guidelines and training on effective AI usage.


Link
View Statistics Without Borders Term Project Presentation



Learning Outcomes

Understand and apply survey-based data collection methods for assessing technology adoption.
Analyze and interpret survey data using statistical methods, including cross-tabulation and chi-square tests.
Evaluate student perceptions, concerns, and support needs regarding AI tool integration.
Identify the impact of technical expertise on attitudes toward AI usage.
Develop actionable recommendations for improving AI policy, training, and support.




Key Skills Gained

Survey Design and Data Collection
Statistical Analysis (Cross-tabulation, Chi-Square Tests)
Data Visualization (R and RStudio)
Generative AI Policy Evaluation
Interpretation of Survey Results
Collaborative Research and Reporting
